channel.title: Need help running Hyperion Client?
channel.description:
I downloaded a blank Hyperion, I ran the server, it said
[code]May 19, 2012 3:37:57 PM org.hyperion.rs2.RS2Server start INFO: Ready[/code]
It loaded successfully without problems.
So then I ran the client. (Through ./data/htdoocs/index.html, the pre-made webclient) It loaded almost all the way, but then got stuck at "Loading Animations - 95%". It didn't move. Then I refresh and it said "An error occurred whist loading RuneScape." Then I close it and re open it, and it gets stuck at Loading Animations - 95% again!
How do I run Hyperion's client?
-Thanks

item.title: Need help running Hyperion Client?
item.dc:creator: @Level_120_Dungeoneer Level 120 Dungeoneering
item.description:
@Level_120_Dungeoneer wrote:

[quote author=Level 120 Dungeoneering link=topic=545349.msg3997474#msg3997474 date=1337472886]

[quote=“shank beast, post:8, topic:442664”]GOod luck.

MediaFire

My RS-Remake Client (to level 120 Dung).rar

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.


Hope it works, fingures crossed.[/quote]

Sorry for not responding! It works beautifully! Thank you everyone!

How would i make it print out the opcode of the packet to the console whist recieving one?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help running Hyperion Client?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Wank, post:1, topic:442676”][quote author=Level 120 Dungeoneering link=topic=545349.msg3997442#msg3997442 date=1337471846]

well, i can provide you with a client however, it may not work but, should. would you like it?

Yes please!

EDIT: Also, do you know a website that has a list of 317 packets? I checked the 317 Packet Documentation page, but it didn’t have much.
[/quote]
http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=Category:Packet:317

All you’ll ever need to know about packets.[/quote]
Or you can just make it so whenever the server receives a packet from you it prints the packet opcode… It makes it very easy to develop servers from scratch doing that

Read full topic
